{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3559859,"name":"Trent","username":"T-Mac","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/t-mac/{size}/264702_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T22:29:22.333Z","cooked":"

Hi Chief Delphi!

I have an interesting problem. Before our first competition I had been attempting to add vision calculation for alignment and swerve Odom updating but was not successful in getting it to work before comp.

However at competition the vision odom updating worked perfectly and I had no issues with it.

Back at our school working on the home field again still doesn’t work and I’m not really sure why. Photon vision is reading the April tags and the April tags are the right number. I attempted to change the field layout in my constants file from welded to andymark and still didn’t change anything.

Anybody have any advice or insight?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T22:29:22.333Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":18,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":124.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495966,"topic_slug":"add-vision-measurement-problems","display_username":"Trent","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67729,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"“Just fill the reef”"},"post_url":"/t/add-vision-measurement-problems/495966/1","custom_user_title":"“Just fill the reef”","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3559868,"name":"David Lame","username":"David_Lame","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T22:38:10.631Z","cooked":"

Can you provide a better description of "doesn’t work?

And is your home field the same dimensions as the competition field.

my first guess would be inaccurate tag placement on the home field. My second guess would be not initializing position correctly. My third guess would be red blue confusion at home. But they are all guesses

I will try these solitons tomorrow and see if it makes any difference.

When I say doesn’t work I mean it’s not updating the odometry using vision. It did update at competition and worked beautifully so I’m just trying to eliminate issues one by one

I have checked the april tags to verify that they are correct.

the cameras are seeing the april tag, the photon vision heartbeat is updating and the boolean box for target seen is updating.

as for next steps. I am going to take a long look at code to see if im not calling something correctly but I find that hard to believe considering it worked at competition and the robot had no drift.

It was suggested to me that I consider re-doing our radios. I plan on doing this as well to see if maybe something is different from the competition configuration and the home config.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-18T22:20:19.153Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":73,"readers_count":72,"score":24.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495966,"topic_slug":"add-vision-measurement-problems","display_username":"Trent","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67729,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"“Just fill the reef”"},"post_url":"/t/add-vision-measurement-problems/495966/6","custom_user_title":"“Just fill the reef”","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3561413,"name":"David Lame","username":"David_Lame","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T02:48:36.179Z","cooked":"
T-Mac:

I will try these solitons tomorrow and see if it makes any difference.

When I say doesn’t work I mean it’s not updating the odometry using vision. It did update at competition and worked beautifully so I’m just trying to eliminate issues one by one

Unfortunately, if it’s not updating at all, then my ideas wouldn’t be valid. I kind of assumed it was updating, but not correctly.

So I am assuming you are calling
poseEstimator.addVisionMeasurement(visionPose, timestamp);

where poseEstimator is a SwerveDrivePoseEstimator object. You are passing a pose that is obtained from some calculation on the AprilTag, and this works at competition, but not at home. At home, examining the poseEstimator estimated position before and after adding the vision measurement, the position doesn’t change.

I wonder if you are getting an improper timestamp? Assuming that you have checked the validity of the Pose2d input, then the timestamp is all that is left. If the timestamp were way off, Photonvision might not compensate. But why would it work at competition, but not at home?

Maybe try running in Practice mode at home, as opposed to enabling autonomous, test, or teleop, and see if the behavior changes? That’s a shot in the dark. My similar code doesn’t care about autonomous versus practice, but practice mode would be one step closer to the way it works on the competition field…assuming you aren’t already doing it.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-19T02:48:36.179Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":15.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495966,"topic_slug":"add-vision-measurement-problems","display_username":"David Lame","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24723,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/add-vision-measurement-problems/495966/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3561604,"name":"Mohammed","username":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T13:21:58.676Z","cooked":"
T-Mac:

It was suggested to me that I consider re-doing our radios.

While you’re at it, try switching the robot’s radio from 2.4 GHz to 6 GHz (If you’re running on 2.4GHz). The drift may be caused by a poor connection. I’m not sure if this will help, but it’s just a guess especially since it worked in comp but not at school.

Yes that is what I am calling. I am going to check the pose2d validity, however from some other debugging it just seems like photon vision isnt giving any data

I am getting a target valid on smartdashboard but it doesnt seem like any other data is being provided

I am now going to be checking via a smartdashboard rightout to see if I am getting any data at all and I will go from there
